content.statement: cea-001-overview is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Carotid-Endarterectomy that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding cea-001-overview helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of cea-001-overview include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of cea-001-overview.

definitions_glossary.endarterectomy: Surgical removal of atherosclerotic plaque from within an artery
definitions_glossary.shunt: Temporary tube allowing continued cerebral blood flow during clamping
definitions_glossary.patch_angioplasty: Widening arteriotomy closure with patch to prevent stenosis
definitions_glossary.eversion_technique: Alternative CEA method everting artery to remove plaque
definitions_glossary.stump_pressure: ICA pressure with CCA clamped, indicates collateral adequacy

symptomatic_stenosis.timing: Within 2 weeks of TIA/stroke is optimal
symptomatic_stenosis.benefit: NNT ~6 for 70-99% stenosis to prevent one stroke over 2 years

asymptomatic_stenosis.benefit: NNT ~17-20 to prevent one stroke over 5 years

contraindications: High surgical risk with minimal symptoms
Severe neurologic deficit (no brain to save)

shunt_use.selective: Based on stump pressure, EEG, or awake monitoring

closure_options.patch: Dacron, PTFE, or vein patch (lower restenosis)

landmark_trials.name: NASCET
landmark_trials.finding: CEA reduces stroke by 65% in symptomatic 70-99% stenosis

landmark_trials.name: ECST
landmark_trials.finding: Confirmed NASCET findings in European population

landmark_trials.name: ACAS
landmark_trials.finding: CEA reduces stroke in asymptomatic ≥60% stenosis if perioperative risk <3%

definition.@value: Surgical removal of atherosclerotic plaque from carotid artery to prevent stroke

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the technique of carotid endarterectomy
List indications for symptomatic and asymptomatic stenosis
Understand the importance of surgical volume and outcomes
Explain the evidence base from landmark trials
clinical_pearls: Symptomatic TIA/stroke should get CEA within 2 weeks for maximum benefit
For asymptomatic stenosis, CEA only helps if perioperative stroke/death <3%
Patch closure reduces restenosis compared to primary closure
CEA is still the gold standard; stenting is for selected high-risk patients

medicalCode.description: Thromboendarterectomy, with or without patch graft, carotid artery
